text.__SUMMARY__: Xenocalamus michelli, or Michell's quill-snouted snake, is a species of venomous rear-fanged snake in the family Lamprophiidae. The species is endemic to Africa.
text.Etymology: The specific name, michelli, is in honor of a Captain Michell who collected the holotype.
text.Geographic range: X. michelli is found in Katanga Province in southern Democratic Republic of the Congo.
text.Further reading: Müller L (1911). "Zwei neue Schlangen aus dem Katangadistrikt, Kongostaat ". Zoologischer Anzeiger 38: 357-360. (Xenocalamaus michelli, new species, pp. 359-360). (in German).
